main event: A very bright spherical object was observed descending off the coast of St. John, New Brunswick, Canada on November 2, 1962.
interesting points: The object was greenish and about half the size of the moon,The sighting lasted approximately 5 seconds,The object was observed to travel from NNW to SSE at a 45Â° angle,It disappeared behind hazy clouds before reappearing and then descending straight downward,The weather was clear with calm seas and a barometer reading of 1031.
witnesses: T.M.S. Irving Glen, Warrant Officer R.C.N.
